required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hepatic Blood Flow Changes During Fluid Challenge Assessed by MRI in Volunteers Subjects.
clinical_study.official_title: Hepatic Blood Flow Changes During Fluid Challenge Assessed by MRI in Volunteers Subjects: a Prospective Monocentric Study. PORTEAU Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Hepatic artery and portal flows are both regulated to assume the whole hepatic blood flow. Each counts for respectively 25% and 75%. That so-called "buffer response" assumes that when portal flow increases, hepatic artery flow decreases. During fluid challenge in intensive care unit, fluid challenge is often administered to improve hepatic perfusion. That observation is not demonstrated. The aim of the study is to test buffer response and portal flow during fluid challenge.

detailed_description.textblock: Prospective monocentric study at Amiens Hospital University. 20 volunteers subjects will be include after providing informed consent. Fluid challenge will be performed with 500 ml of intra venous NaCl (0.9%). Hepatic blood flow measurement will be performed using MRI.

primary_outcome.measure: Portal blood flow measure before and after fluid challenge
primary_outcome.time_frame: Two hours: the difference in hepatic portal flow before and after a volume expansion of 500 ml NaCl 0.9%.
primary_outcome.description: Fluid challenge will be performed with 500 ml of intra venous NaCl (0.9%). Hepatic blood flow measurement will be performed using MRI (magnetic resonance imaging).

secondary_outcome.measure: Hepatic artery blood flow measure before and after fluid challenge
secondary_outcome.description: Hepatic artery blood flow measure before and after a volume expansion of 500 ml NaCl 0.9%.

other_outcome.measure: Flow ratio of portal flow on hepatic artery flow
other_outcome.description: Flow ratio of portal flow on hepatic artery flow before and after a volume expansion of 500 ml NaCl 0.9%.

arm_group.description: Hepatic blood flow baseline will be measured using MRI. Fluid challenge of 500 ml of NaCl 0.9% will be administered during 10 minutes. Before and After fluid challenge, MRI will be performed to compare flow changes.

intervention.description: Fluid challenge will be performed with 500 ml of intra venous NaCl (0.9%). Hepatic blood flow measurement will be performed using MRI.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Fasting for the last 12 hours.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Claustrophobia
- Any previous medical history disease;
- Any abdominal surgical disease
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding
